XmlWorldData.name: First Tutorial
XmlWorldData.description: This is the first tutorial. In this tutorial you will learn how to add a Kodu <kodu> to your world and program him to respond to user input.
XmlWorldData.creator: scoy

Step.GamepadText: Welcome to the first Kodu Game Lab tutorial. During the tutorial you will see a bar at the top of the screen with instructions for you to follow. These instructions will guide you through the actions needed to complete the tutorial.

Step.GamepadText:
This tutorial will teach you how to: :1) Add a Kodu <kodu> to your world. :2) Program the Kodu <kodu> to respond to user controls.
First, let's start by adding Kodu <kodu> to the world.

Step.GamepadText: Programs for the Kodu Game Lab characters are created as a sequence of numbered rows. Each row has a WHEN part and a DO part. When the WHEN side is true, then the action on the DO side is done. For example: :WHEN <sensor.eyes><filter.fruit> DO <actuator.movement><selector.towardclosest> In this case when the character sees an apple the character will move toward it. For now, let's program Kodu <kodu> to move under your control.
Step.MouseText: Programs for the Kodu Game Lab characters are created as a sequence of numbered rows. Each row has a WHEN part and a DO part. When the WHEN side is true, then the action on the DO side is done. For example: :WHEN <sensor.eyes><filter.fruit> DO <actuator.movement><selector.towardclosest> In this case when the character sees an apple the character will move toward it. For now, let's program Kodu <kodu> to move under your control.
Step.TouchText: Programs for the Kodu Game Lab characters are created as a sequence of numbered rows. Each row has a WHEN part and a DO part. When the WHEN side is true, then the action on the DO side is done. For example: :WHEN <sensor.eyes><filter.fruit> DO <actuator.movement><selector.towardclosest> In this case when the character sees an apple the character will move toward it. For now, let's program Kodu <kodu> to move under your control.

Step.GamepadText: On the first row move the pencil cursor to the plus sign next to WHEN then press <a> to add <sensor.gamepad>
Step.MouseText: On the first row click on the plus sign next to WHEN and select <sensor.keyboard>
Step.TouchText: On the first row tap on the plus sign next to WHEN and select <sensor.touch>

Step.GamepadText: On the plus sign next to the gamepad <sensor.gamepad> press <a> to add <filter.leftstick>
Step.MouseText: Click on the plus sign next to the keyboard <sensor.keyboard> and select <filter.ArrowKeys>
Step.TouchText: Tap on the plus sign next to touch <sensor.touch> and select <filter.touch.gesture.tap>

Step.GamepadText: Now move the pencil cursor to the right of DO on the first row and add <actuator.movement> When done you should have WHEN <sensor.gamepad> <filter.leftstick> do <actuator.movement>
Step.MouseText: Now click on the plus sign to the right of DO and add <actuator.movement> When done you should have WHEN <sensor.keyboard><filter.ArrowKeys> do <actuator.movement>
Step.TouchText: Now tap on the plus sign to the right of DO and add <actuator.movement> When done you should have WHEN <sensor.touch><filter.touch.gesture.tap> do <actuator.movement>

Step.Comment: Note that this step is only used in touch mode.
Step.TouchText: Now tap on the plus sign and add <selector.towardclosest> When done you should have WHEN <sensor.touch><filter.touch.gesture.tap> do <actuator.movement> <selector.towardclosest>

Step.Comment: Pause when done with the programming.

Step.GamepadText: Hey you're done! Now that you've programmed Kodu it's time to run the game again and see your work in action.
Step.MouseText: Hey you're done! Now that you've programmed Kodu it's time to run the game again and see your work in action.
Step.TouchText: Hey you're done! Now that you've programmed Kodu it's time to run the game again and see your work in action.

Step.GamepadText: Use the left stick <leftstick> to move Kodu.
Step.MouseText: Use the arrow keys [leftarrow][uparrow][rightarrow] to move Kodu.
Step.TouchText: Tap on the ground to move Kodu.

Step.GamepadText: Congratulations! In this tutorial you've learned how to add a Kodu to your world and then program the Kodu to move under your control. You can use this same idea to add and program other characters now. Have fun!
